qas.question: In May 2008, The Times switched from what plant to new plants in Broxbourne, Merseyside, and Glasgow?
In 2008, The Times switched to a new plant in Broxbourne, which is on the outskirts of what city?
In May 2008, The Times switched to new plants which allowed for what kind of feature to be printed on every page for the first time?

context: In May 2008 printing of The Times switched from <a0_0>Wapping<a0_0/> to new plants at Broxbourne on the outskirts of <a1_0>London<a1_0/>, and Merseyside and Glasgow, enabling the paper to be produced with <a2_0>full colour<a2_0/> on every page for the first time.
